com.samskivert.depot

Class PersistenceContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.depot.PersistenceContext

  • public class PersistenceContext
extends Object
    Defines a scope in which global annotations are shared.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PersistenceContext.CacheEvictionFilter<T extends Serializable>
      A simple implementation of PersistenceContext.CacheTraverser that selectively deletes entries in a cache depending on the return value of PersistenceContext.CacheEvictionFilter.testForEviction(java.io.Serializable, T).
      static interface  PersistenceContext.CacheListener<T>
      A cache listener is notified when cache entries change.
      static interface  PersistenceContext.CacheTraverser<T extends Serializable>
      The callback for cacheTraverse(java.lang.Class<? extends com.samskivert.depot.PersistentRecord>, com.samskivert.depot.PersistenceContext.CacheTraverser<T>); this is called for each entry in a given cache.
      static class  PersistenceContext.CanMigrate
      Used by PersistenceContext(CanMigrate).

      • registerMigration

        public <T extends PersistentRecord> void registerMigration(Class<T> type,
                                                           SchemaMigration migration)
        Registers a schema migration for the specified entity class.

        This method must be called before an Entity is used by any repository. Thus you should register all migrations in the constructor of the repository that declares them in its DepotRepository.getManagedRecords(java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends com.samskivert.depot.PersistentRecord>>) method.

        Note that the migration process is as follows:

        • Note the difference between the entity's declared version and the version recorded in the database.
        • Run all registered pre-migrations
        • Perform all default migrations (column and index additions, index removals)
        • Run all registered post-migrations
        Thus you must either be prepared for the entity to be at any version prior to your migration target version because we may start up, find the schema at version 1 and the Entity class at version 8 and do all "standard" migrations in one fell swoop. So if a column got added in version 2 and renamed in version 6 and your migration was registered for version 6 to do that migration, it must be prepared for the column not to exist at all.

        If you want a completely predictable migration process, never use the default migrations and register a pre-migration for every single schema migration and they will then be guaranteed to be run in registration order and with predictable pre- and post-conditions.

        Note that if initializeRepositories(boolean) is used, then all schema migrations for all known repositories will be run and then all data migrations for all known repositories will be run. This is recommeneded because schema migrations may fail and it is generally better to have not yet done the data migration rather than having schema and data migrations interleaved and potentially leaving the database in a strange state.

      • cacheClear

        public void cacheClear(Class<? extends PersistentRecord> pClass,
                       boolean localOnly)
        Requests that the cache for the specified persistent record be cleared. Note that this clears only the by-primary-key cache for the index in question. It does not clear the keyset or contents query caches. Use Query.clearCache(boolean) to clear these caches.
        Parameters:
        localOnly - if true, only the cache in this JVM will be cleared, no broadcast message will be sent to instruct all distributed nodes to also clear this cache.

      • cacheClear

        public void cacheClear(String cacheId,
                       boolean localOnly)
        Requests that the cache with the specified id be cleared.
        Parameters:
        localOnly - if true, only the cache in this JVM will be cleared, no broadcast message will be sent to instruct all distributed nodes to also clear this cache.

      • initializeRepositories

        public void initializeRepositories(boolean warnOnLazyInit)
                            throws DatabaseException
        Initializes all repositories that have been created and registered with this persistence context. Any repositories that are constructed after this call will be immediately initialized at the time they are constructed (which is probably undesirable). When a repository is initialized, schema migrations for all of its managed persistent records are run. It is best to do all schema migrations when the system initializes which is why lazy initialization of repositories is undesirable.
        Parameters:
        warnOnLazyInit - if true, any repositories are constructed after this method is called will result in a warning so that the application developer can restructure their code to ensure that those repositories are properly created prior to this call.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException
